title: 820-00165 no power
message:
Hi guys,

Got this 820-00165 which initially had minor corrosion around U7090, no green light. Found blown D7012, replaced and now got green light but no fan spin. 

PPDC_IN is only 16.44v, PPBUS_G3H is 0.3v

Any idea where to go on this one?

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
"PPDC_IN is only 16.44v"
Looks perfect for me; in fact, its exact value depends by charger type.

Check diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H.
Post U7100 basic voltages: pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
Hi 2informaticos,

Fair enough, I was expecting nearer to 18v thanks for clarifying!

Diode mode PPBUS_G3H = 0.130v

U7100:

1: 15v
2: 16.41v
3: 4.31v
9: 0.02v
12: 3.37v
13: 3.34v
14: 3.34v
15: 0.11v
17: 0.5v
19: 0.5v
20: 0.3v
27: 1.38v

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
"19: 0.5v
20: 0.3v"
Check diode mode too; may need to change U7100.


"I was expecting nearer to 18v"
"its exact value depends by charger type"
Did you check with 85W charger?
However, your board must work with 45W charger.

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
Sorry, for some reason I though I had an 85W charger connected not a 60w, so 16.44 is obviously perfectly fine

Getting OL diode mode to ground on both 19 and 20

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
U7100 changed, R7101 tested ok but changed anyway as I had some brand new ones.

No change, board still not powering on

title: 820-00165 no power
message:
Please post useful information!

Do you get at least correct PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_S5?
